intro: Corynandra aspera, commonly known as the rough corynandra, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, elliptical leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule containing numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Corynandra aspera is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
